arts.ttl: Colchester United 1 Morecambe 0 - reaction from Danny Cowley after U's win
arts.sum: Mandela Egbo's deflected second-half strike proved enough to secure the U's all three points against a Shrimps side who played more than half of the contest with ten men after Lee Angol was sent off for a foul on Ellis Iandolo, on the stroke of half-time. Cowley said: “It was a very deserved win and I was proud of the players.

arts.ttl: Colchester United 1 Morecambe 0 - match report as U's see off ten-man Shrimps
arts.sum: Egbo netted just before the midway point in the second half when his effort deflected off Rhys Williams and in to earn the U's victory over a stubborn Shrimps side, who had played for more than half of the game with only ten men after striker Lee Angol's straight red card for serious foul play. MATCH STATS: COLCHESTER UNITED: Macey, Egbo, Kelleher (sub Taylor, 55), Flanagan, Iandolo, McDonnell, Bishop (sub Read, 87), Anderson (sub Thorn, 55), Payne, Edwards (sub Gordon, 87), Simpson (sub Tucker, 74).

arts.ttl: Mandela Egbo’s second-half strike enough as Colchester edge 10-man Morecambe
arts.sum: Egbo’s 65th-minute deflected shot flew into the net to seal victory for the U’s over the struggling Shrimps.

arts.ttl: Matt Jay has joined Torquay after Colchester United exit
arts.sum: It was a sad ending to Jay’s rather baffling time at Colchester, where it’s probably fair to say that fans did not see anywhere near the best of the talented attacker. Jay was hoping that more time would come under Garner’s replacement Matty Etherington but his appearances were once again limited, leaving U’s fans scratching their heads as to why he was not given more of a chance to play games, particularly in a struggling side.

arts.ttl: Colchester United play host to Morecambe in League Two
arts.sum: Tyreece Simpson is also pushing for a start after making his U's debut as a substitute at Harrogate Town on Tuesday night but boss Danny Cowley could stick with the same starting line-up for the fourth successive game. From predicted line-ups to team news, here's all you need to know can be found below ahead of the clash (kick-off 3pm).

arts.ttl: Danny Cowley eager for Colchester United to show progress against Morecambe
arts.sum: The U's are aiming to follow up two positive away results with a win over struggling Morecambe tomorrow and head coach Cowley said: “I think we’ve learnt a lot from that early period in the season. “I think they’ve only played one game since January 1st and we’ve just played three away games in a week, so we have all of these challenges to try to overcome but that’s exciting in itself.

Colchester's 0-0 with Harrogate in midweek made it two games without defeat and two consecutive clean sheets. Morecambe's 1-0 defeat to Crewe last weekend was their seventh defeat in their last nine ...

arts.ttl: Tom Hopper set to leave Colchester United in transfer window
arts.sum: "The only certainty in football is that there's going to be uncertainty and I always try to give clarity to players, because I always think the players perform best when they have clarity and they have as much certainty as you can give them, in football. Hopper joined Colchester from League One side Lincoln City in January, 2023.

arts.ttl: New Colchester United signing Jack Tucker on MK Dons switch
arts.sum: “Two clean sheets away from home is always a very positive thing “I’m looking forward to being part of a hopefully sold backline. “It’s a good opportunity for me; having spoken to the manager, he sold the club and everything about the place really well.

arts.ttl: Colchester United sign defender Jack Tucker from MK Dons
arts.sum: "He had some Premier League clubs looking at him, at that time - I remember going to a game and watched him play with Mark Robson at West Ham and I know they were interested in him, at the time. Tucker started his career at Gillingham, joining them at the age of seven years old.
